channel.title: Talks By F. Enzio Busche
channel.description: General Conference talks by F. Enzio Busche.

item.title: They Didn’t Give Up
item.description: I’m deeply touched by the spirit of this building, by the presence of a prophet of the Lord, by the presence of the members of the General Authorities, and by your presence. I pray that I will find words to express my feelings in this moment.

item.title: Do We All Believe in the Same God?
item.description: As I stand here before you at this moment, I cannot help but think back to the day when I, as an investigator of the Church, was confronted with the missionaries’ challenge to prepare for my baptism. This step seemed to be too big for me to take, but

item.title: Love Is the Power That Will Cure the Family
item.description: There has never been a time in the entire history of mankind when marriage and the institution of the family have been so endangered as in this generation. Nearly all the circumstances that have made family life in the past the most natural way for p

item.title: The Joy of the Penetrating Light
item.description: In one of the large cities of this world there is a man standing at the window of his apartment, looking at the gray colors of a rainy day. “This is not an ordinary day,” he reflects to himself as he watches the two young men, who have just paid him

item.title: University for Eternal Life
item.description: I am overwhelmed with feelings of joy and deep gratitude to be able to participate in this gathering of the Saints of the latter days in this great conference. It is impossible to describe with words the feelings that Sister Busche and I share as we

item.title: Truth Is the Issue
item.description: In the Doctrine and Covenants, section 1, verse 4, we read, “And the voice of warning shall be unto all people, by the mouths of my disciples, whom I have chosen in these last days.” []

item.title: Freedom “from” or Freedom “to”
item.description: We … become alive as we take, knowingly, full responsibility for our own life and as we stop blaming circumstances.
